request.title: routing/bgp Parcel Schema
request.description: routing/bgp profile parcel schema for request

external.description: Set administrative distance for external BGP routes

internal.description: Set administrative distance for internal BGP routes

local.description: Set administrative distance for local BGP routes

keepalive.description: Interval (seconds) of keepalive messages sent to its BGP peer

holdtime.description: Interval (seconds) not receiving a keepalive message declares a BGP peer down

alwaysCompare.description: Compare MEDs from all ASs when selecting active BGP paths

deterministic.description: Compare MEDs from all routes from same AS when selecting active BGP paths

missingAsWorst.description: If path has no MED, consider it to be worst path when selecting active BGP paths

compareRouterId.description: Compare router IDs when selecting active BGP paths

shutdown.description: Enable or disable a BGP neighbor

localAs.description: Set local autonomous number,Local-AS cannot have the local BGP protocol AS number or the AS number of the remote peer.The local-as is valid only if the peer is a true eBGP peer. It does not work for two peers in different sub-ASs in a confederation.

keepalive.description: Interval (seconds) of keepalive messages sent to its BGP peer

holdtime.description: Interval (seconds) not receiving a keepalive message declares a BGP peer down

ifName.description: Source interface name for BGP neighbor

nextHopSelf.description: Set router to be next hop for routes advertised to neighbor

ebgpMultihop.description: Set TTL value for peers that are not directly connected

password.description: Set MD5 password on TCP connection with BGP peer

asOverride.description: Override matching AS-number while sending update

asNumber.description: The number of accept as-path with my AS present in it

maxPrefixConfig.description: Set maximum number of prefixes accepted from BGP peer and threshold exceeded policy actions(restart or warning)

policyType.description: Neighbor received maximum prefix policy is disabled.
Neighbor maximum prefix policy is enabled, when maximum prefix threshold is exceeded, policy action is restarting device.

prefixNum.description: Set maximum number of prefixes accepted from BGP peer

threshold.description: Set threshold(1 to 100) at which to generate a warning message

restartInterval.description: Set the restart interval(minutes) when to restart BGP connection if threshold is exceeded

policyType.description: Neighbor maximum prefix policy is enabled, when maximum prefix threshold is exceeded, policy action is warning-only or disable-peer.

prefixNum.description: Set maximum number of prefixes accepted from BGP peer

threshold.description: Set threshold(1 to 100) at which to generate a warning message

shutdown.description: Enable or disable a BGP neighbor

localAs.description: Set local autonomous number,Local-AS cannot have the local BGP protocol AS number or the AS number of the remote peer.The local-as is valid only if the peer is a true eBGP peer. It does not work for two peers in different sub-ASs in a confederation.

keepalive.description: Set how often to advertise keepalive messages to BGP peer

holdtime.description: Set how long to wait since receiving a keepalive message to consider BGP peer unavailable

ifName.description: Source interface name for BGP neighbor

nextHopSelf.description: Set router to be next hop for routes advertised to neighbor

ebgpMultihop.description: Set TTL value for peers that are not directly connected

password.description: Set MD5 password on TCP connection with BGP peer

asOverride.description: Override matching AS-number while sending update

asNumber.description: The number of accept as-path with my AS present in it

maxPrefixConfig.description: Set maximum number of prefixes accepted from BGP peer and threshold exceeded policy actions(restart or warning)

policyType.description: Neighbor received maximum prefix policy is disabled.
Neighbor maximum prefix policy is enabled, when maximum prefix threshold is exceeded, policy action is restarting device.

prefixNum.description: Set maximum number of prefixes accepted from BGP peer

threshold.description: Set threshold(1 to 100) at which to generate a warning message

restartInterval.description: Set the restart interval(minutes) when to restart BGP connection if threshold is exceeded

policyType.description: Neighbor maximum prefix policy is enabled, when maximum prefix threshold is exceeded, policy action is warning-only or disable-peer.

prefixNum.description: Set maximum number of prefixes accepted from BGP peer

threshold.description: Set threshold(1 to 100) at which to generate a warning message

addressFamily.description: Set IPv4 unicast BGP address family

prefix.description: Configure the IPv4 prefixes to aggregate

summaryOnly.description: Filter out more specific routes from updates

network.description: Configure the networks for BGP to advertise

prefix.description: Configure the prefixes for BGP to announce

paths.description: Set maximum number of parallel IBGP paths for multipath load sharing

protocol.description: Set the protocol to redistribute routes from

routePolicy.description: Configure policy to apply to prefixes received from BGP neighbor

ipv6AggregateAddress.description: IPv6 Aggregate prefixes in specific range

prefix.description: Configure the IPv6 prefixes to aggregate

summaryOnly.description: Filter out more specific routes from updates

ipv6Network.description: Configure the networks for BGP to advertise

prefix.description: Configure the prefixes for BGP to announce

paths.description: Set maximum number of parallel IBGP paths for multipath load sharing

protocol.description: Set the protocol to redistribute routes from

routePolicy.description: Configure policy to apply to prefixes received from BGP neighbor

documentation.description: This is the documentation for request schema for routing/bgp profile parcel
documentation.details-1: variable name should be present with given format as specified in schema if optionType value is variable
documentation.details-2: variable name should not be present if optionType value is NOT variable
documentation.details-3: when option Type is global,  value should be present with given format/restrictions as specified in schema
documentation.details-4: when option Type is default, value should be present with given default value as specified in schema
